HOTSPOT -
A company is implementing case management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.
The company has the following requirements:
✑ Create a simplified user interface to create new cases.
✑ Send a confirmation email after a case is submitted.
✑ Create a report to display case metrics.
You need to determine which technologies meet the requirements.
Which technologies should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Power Apps -
Use Power Apps canvas apps for simple UI handling cases.

Box 2: Power Automate -
You can customize emails for Power Automate flows.

Box 3: Power BI -
Power BI can produce reports.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-automate/email-customization

discussion.content: Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI are correct.
This is the exact question as in Topic 2/Question: 35/Page 8, but the first answer there isn't the same as the one shown here.
Model-driven apps don't work for external users as customers, so it must be Power virtual agent.

1. Power Virtual Agents
2. Power Automate
Correct Answers ^^
Power Virtual Agents lets you create powerful AI-powered chatbots for a range of requests—from providing simple answers to common questions to resolving issues requiring complex conversations.

Power Virtual Agents are chatbots that can be embedded on a website or other platforms. They can interact with customers, understand their inquiries, and retrieve information from databases, including inventory data, to provide real-time responses. This makes them an excellent choice for enabling customers to check store inventory directly from the company's website in an interactive and user-friendly manner.
So the answer is A.
PVA is the right answer. You can not embed MD apps on the company website. PVA can fetch the results.

As we're talking about a D365 Supply Chain App and its integration with a Website, I'm thinking about the new "Inventory Visibility" capability, which is connected with Dataverse, so I would say it's possible to have a Model-driven app for inventory checking...

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/inventory/inventory-visibility

The second must be Power Automate.

1. Power Virtual Agent
2. Power Automate
Same question as Topic 2 Question 35 as mentioned by others.
Cant use Model-driven app to check stock unless only customers on the website are authenticated users. Power BI can't be used as it doesn't generate a trigger when a 0 stock level is found by a customer. Answer 1 has to be Power Virtual Agent

DRAG DROP -
A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to store inventory. The company has a website to display product information.
The company wants to add the following capabilities to the website:
✑ Allow customers to check store inventory.
✑ Send an email to the product purchasing manager if a customer checks store inventory and the product is not in stock.
You need to configure the system.
What should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate technology to the correct requirements. Each technology may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Dynamics 365 Commerce -
Loyalty programs can help increase customer loyalty by rewarding customers for their interactions with the retailer's brand. In Dynamics 365 Commerce, you can set up simple or complex loyalty programs that apply across your legal entities in any commerce channel.
You can set up your loyalty program so that they include the following options.
* Set up multiple types of rewards that you offer in your loyalty programs, and track participation in your loyalty programs.
* Etc.

Box 2: Dynamics 365 Commerce -
You can manage clienteling in Dynamics 365 Commerce.
Clienteling empowers sales associates to become trusted advisors and establish long-term relationships with their customers. Dynamics 365 Customer Insights helps organizations to gather disparate data, be it from transactional, observational, or behavioral sources, to gain a unified view of customers, and derive intelligent insights that drive key business processes.

Box 3: Dynamics 365 Finance -
Use Dynamics 365 Finance to manage customer ledger entries to reconcile payments
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/commerce/set-up-customer-loyalty-program https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/manage-clienteling/
